faveComics.title: Backslashes
faveComics.alt: I searched my .bash_history for the line with the highest ratio of special characters to regular alphanumeric characters, and the winner was: cat out.txt | grep -o

faveComics.title: Dangers
faveComics.alt: Zero results: 'snake charming' and 'haberdashery'.  (Things like 'car' and 'boating' and such are of course the highest, by a huge margin.)

faveComics.title: Content Protection
faveComics.alt: If you think the purveyors of DRM simply want to protect artists, check out chapters 13 and 14 in Free Culture, by Lawrence Lessig.  Their goal is the elimination of all culture they don't control.

faveComics.title: Julia Stiles
faveComics.alt: I found an old tape of this episode in my family's closet.  Check the news section of the forums to see the clip!

faveComics.title: Apple Jacks
faveComics.alt: There used to be these ads, see . . .

faveComics.title: Digital Rights Management
faveComics.alt: If you're interested in the subject, Lawrence Lessig's 'Free Culture' is pretty good

faveComics.title: In Popular Culture
faveComics.alt: Someday the 'in popular culture' section will have its own article with an 'in popular culture' section.  It will reference this title-text referencing it, and the blogosphere will implode.

faveComics.title: Troll Slayer
faveComics.alt: We have met the enemy and he is us.

faveComics.title: 1337: Part 4
faveComics.alt: Mrs. Roberts would have gotten up sooner, of course, but she was busy piping find ~ and find ~nomad into xargs shred, just in case.
